question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Find the range of the function \[f(x) = \left\{ \begin{aligned} x^2 & \quad \text{ if } x \le 0 \\ x^3 - 5 & \quad \text{ if } x > 0. \end{aligned} \right.\]
inference: Final Answer: \\boxed{(-\infty, \infty)}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: For $x \le 0,$ the expression $x^2$ takes all nonnegative values. Meanwhile, for $x > 0,$ the expression $x^3$ takes all positive values, so $x^3 - 5$ takes all values in the interval $(-5, \infty).$ It follows that the range of $f(x)$ is the union of the two intervals $[0, \infty)$ and $(-5, \infty).$ Because the second interval contains the first one, the range of $f(x)$ is simply $\boxed{(-5, \infty)}.$
